intro: Hieracium canovittatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its yellow flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Hieracium canovittatum is often found in open habitats and can spread vegetatively through its rhizomes.
